page.title: 12A64 Trunk Road
page.content: This south_west route from York (Eboracum) to Tadcaster (Calcaria) has been important since Roman times.It follows in part the course of the old Roman road.In 1745 a Turnpike Act set up a Trust to control the road between Tadcaster Bridge and Hob Moor.This was part of the Mail Coach run between York and London until the expansion of the railways in the 1840s. In 1936 a dual carriage way was built to improve traffic flow between the West Riding industrial conurbation and the East Coast holiday resorts. There was a separate road, cycle track and footpath in each direction.The last two have disappeared due to road alterations.Further change came with the construction of bye_passes round Tadcaster, York and Malton.(c.1970) The Ebor Way a 70 mile walk _Helmsley to Ilkley follows the Roman road here.
